home.title: Welcome to NextBike
home.subtitle: Digital Product Passports and Connected Manufacturing with the Asset Administration Shell

dppCard.title: Digital Product Passport
dppCard.description: Learn more about the digital product passport and its significance for Industry 4.0

projectCard.title: The Project
projectCard.description: Discover the virtual NextBike factory and the complete digital value chain

membersCard.title: Our Members
membersCard.description: Meet the companies that made this project possible

stageTalk.title: SPS Stage Talk
stageTalk.description: Download the presentation slides from the SPS Stage Talk here. The talk provides exciting insights into the practical implementation of the DPP with the Asset Administration Shell and the NextBike project.

whitePaper.title: White Paper: AAS Tool Landscape
whitePaper.description: This white paper provides a comprehensive overview of the Asset Administration Shell (AAS) tool landscape. It presents various tools that can be used for implementing and managing AAS-based solutions, and provides practical insights into their application possibilities.

whatIs.title: What is a Digital Product Passport?
whatIs.intro: The Digital Product Passport (DPP) is a digital twin of a physical product that contains all relevant information about the entire lifecycle of the product.

transparency.label: Transparency:
transparency.description: Complete documentation of origin, materials, and manufacturing steps

sustainability.label: Sustainability:
sustainability.description: Tracking of CO2 footprint and environmental impacts

maintenance.label: Maintenance & Service:
maintenance.description: Documentation of maintenance history and technical specifications

practice.title: DPP in Practice
practice.description1: In the NextBike project, the DPP is realized through the Asset Administration Shell (AAS). The AAS enables the standardized digital representation of assets and their properties throughout the entire product lifecycle.
practice.description2: From the supplier through production to the end customer, all data is captured, linked, and made available through standardized interfaces. This enables complete traceability and creates the foundation for intelligent services and data-driven business models.

overview.title: Project Overview
overview.description1: The NextBike project is a demonstration platform for the virtual factory of the future. It was developed over an extended period in collaboration with the Open Industry 4.0 Alliance (OI4) and a number of leading

valueChain.title: Complete Digital Value Chain
valueChain.description: The project demonstrates how a complete digital value chain can be represented using the Asset Administration Shell (AAS) - from suppliers through the parts catalog and configuration to production and the final Digital Product Passport (DPP).

suppliers.title: Supplier Integration
suppliers.description: Connection of suppliers via standardized AAS interfaces

catalog.title: Digital Parts Catalog
catalog.description: Central management of all components and their properties

configurator.title: Configurator
configurator.description: Customization of products according to customer requirements

goods.title: Goods Receipt
goods.description: Digital recording and tracking of incoming materials

machines.title: Machine Integration
machines.description: Real-time connection of production facilities during manufacturing

dpp.title: Digital Product Passport
dpp.description: Complete documentation of the finished product

predecessor.title: Predecessor Projects
predecessor.intro: The NextBike project builds on the findings and results of the following predecessor projects:

transfer.title: Transfer of Ownership
transfer.description: Demonstration of digital asset ownership transfer across the entire value chain, including automatic transfer of responsibilities and rights.

notification.title: Product Change Notification
notification.description: System for automatic notification of product changes along the supply chain, enabling quick responses to design changes or quality issues.

architecture.title: Technical Architecture
architecture.description: For detailed information on the technical implementation and architecture of the project, please visit our dedicated architecture page.

members.title: Project Members

oi4.title: Open Industry 4.0 Alliance
oi4.description1: The NextBike project was developed under the leadership of the Open Industry 4.0 Alliance (OI4). The OI4 is a cross-manufacturer association that promotes open standards in Industry 4.0 and fosters interoperability between different systems and manufacturers.
oi4.description2: Through collaboration in the OI4 Alliance, it is ensured that the developed solutions are applicable industry-wide and comply with the latest standards.

members.companiesIntro: The following companies have actively contributed to the development of the NextBike project:

Illegal content was not recognizable at the time of linking.
impressum.linksLiabilityText2: However, permanent monitoring of the content of linked pages is not reasonable without concrete evidence of a legal violation. Upon becoming aware of legal violations, we will remove such links immediately.

impressum.projectInfoText: The NextBike project is a showcase application demonstrating Digital Product Passports and Asset Administration Shells in a virtual factory. The project was created by the Open Industry 4.0 Alliance and its member companies.
